description: Grade 3 Coding Templates - Interactive Scratch Activities

templates.name: Maze Runner Game
templates.description: Kid builds a maze game where sprite must reach goal without hitting walls
templates.why_engaging: Kids LOVE maze games - immediate visual feedback, sense of accomplishment

example_item.subject: coding
example_item.question:
BUILD IT: Make the cat escape the maze!

Drag the blocks to complete the code:

when [arrow key] pressed
move (10) steps
if <touching [wall]?> then
  [YOUR CODE HERE]
end

tier1.teach: If touching wall, go back to start. The IF block checks a condition and runs code when true.

steps.voice_text: The IF block asks a question. Is the cat touching the wall?
When touching wall is TRUE, run this code. The cat goes back to start!

tier2.teach: IF means 'when this happens, do this.' Touch wall? Go back to start!

steps.voice_text: Cat hits wall... BONK! Cat goes back to start. That's what IF does!

templates.name: Candy Collector Score Game
templates.description: Kid creates a game that tracks and displays score when collecting items
templates.why_engaging: Collecting things + seeing score go up = instant dopamine hit for kids

example_item.subject: coding
example_item.question:
BUILD IT: Make the score go up when you catch candy!

Complete the code:

when green flag clicked
set [score] to (0)

when this sprite clicked
[YOUR CODE HERE]
play sound [chomp]
hide

available_blocks.why_wrong: This SETS score to 1, doesn't ADD 1

tier1.teach: Variables store information. CHANGE adds to what's already there. SET replaces it completely.

steps.voice_text: Score is a variable. It starts at zero. Watch what happens when we click candy!
CHANGE adds one to score. Zero plus one equals one! Click more candy, score goes higher!

tier2.teach: Score is like a piggy bank. CHANGE adds coins. SET dumps it all out and puts new coins in.

steps.voice_text: You had 3 candies. Got one more. Now you have 4! That's CHANGE - it ADDS!

templates.name: Debug Detective - Fix the Bug!
templates.description: Kid finds and fixes bugs in broken code - detective style investigation
templates.why_engaging: Kids feel SMART when they find bugs. Detective theme adds mystery/excitement

example_item.subject: coding
example_item.question:
DETECTIVE CASE #1: The code is broken! Find the bug!

This code should make the cat say 'Hello!' when clicked.
But nothing happens. What's wrong?

üîç THE BUGGY CODE:
when green flag clicked
say [Hello!] for (2) seconds
example_item.answer: Wrong event block - should be 'when this sprite clicked' not 'when green flag clicked'

tier1.teach: Different 'when' blocks trigger at different times. Clicked vs Green Flag are NOT the same!

data.annotation: This runs when you click the GREEN FLAG

steps.voice_text: Look at the first block. When green flag clicked runs when you press the green flag, NOT when you click the cat!

data.annotation: NOW it runs when you click the cat!

steps.voice_text: When this sprite clicked means click on the cat. Bug fixed! Now it works!

tier2.teach: Green flag = start button. Click sprite = click on the character. Different things!

frames.label: Click Sprite
frames.action: Runs when you click THIS character

steps.voice_text: Green flag starts everything. Click sprite only works when you click THAT character!

templates.name: Make Your Character Talk
templates.description: Kid builds an interactive conversation where character responds to user input
templates.why_engaging: Kids love making characters 'talk back' - personalized responses are magical

example_item.subject: coding
example_item.question:
BUILD IT: Make the cat ask your name, then say hi to YOU!

Complete the code:

when green flag clicked
ask [What is your name?] and wait
say [YOUR CODE HERE] for (2) seconds

available_blocks.why_wrong: Just says Hello, doesn't use your name

tier1.teach: ASK gets input from the user. ANSWER stores what they typed. JOIN glues words together!

steps.voice_text: When you type your name, it goes into a special variable called ANSWER.
JOIN glues words together. Hello plus Emma equals Hello Emma!

tier2.teach: ASK is like asking a question. ANSWER is what they said. JOIN sticks words together like glue!

steps.voice_text: Cat asks. You answer. Cat says hello with YOUR name. Cool right?

templates.name: Make It Rain! (Clone Creator)
templates.description: Kid creates multiple copies of sprite using clones - makes it 'rain' objects
templates.why_engaging: Making LOTS of things appear is visually exciting, feels like real coding power

example_item.subject: coding
example_item.question:
BUILD IT: Make it rain stars!

Complete the code to create star clones:

when green flag clicked
forever
  [YOUR CODE HERE]
  wait (0.5) seconds
end

available_blocks.why_wrong: Stamp makes a picture, not a real sprite

tier1.teach: CREATE CLONE makes a copy of the sprite. Each clone can do its own thing!

steps.voice_text: Create clone makes a copy. The forever loop keeps making copies. Star rain!

blocks: when I start as a clone

steps.voice_text: Each new clone runs its own code. It appears random, falls down, then disappears!

tier2.teach: CLONE means copy. Like a copy machine for sprites! Each copy can move on its own.

steps.voice_text: One star becomes two, then three, then lots! That's clones! Star rain!

activity_types.BUILD: Kid drags/places blocks to complete working code, then tests it
activity_types.FIX: Kid finds and fixes bugs in broken code
activity_types.PREDICT: Kid predicts what code will do, then runs it to check
activity_types.REMIX: Kid modifies working code to change behavior
activity_types.CREATE: Kid builds something from scratch with guidance

interaction_types.drag_blocks_then_test: Drag correct blocks into place, then click RUN to test
interaction_types.build_and_test: Complete the code, test immediately, see results
interaction_types.find_and_fix: Find the bug, click to fix, test before/after
